text: you haven't started making your own
granola at home I highly recommend doing
it now today I'm making a delicious
dried blueberry granola that's a
fantastic make-ahead dish for brunch say
you're going to somebody's house or
mother's day it's great it's a gift you
can make it in bigger small batches it's
endlessly variable and it's really easy
and simple and today's recipe in
particular is simple because it only has
a few ingredients you want to go crazy
and add more be my guest I've just added
2 cups of rolled oats to a baking sheet
and then I'm making a mixture of 2
tablespoons of vegetable oil and 2
tablespoons of honey that's going to
keep the granola from sticking to the
pan a little bit it's going to add
sweetness and flavor you can whisk those
two together we're not gonna go on quite
yet to that you can add a pinch of salt
recipe doesn't call for salt but you
know me and I like to add a little bit
of salt to all dishes sweet and savory I
just really feel like it enhances the
flavor
so go ahead head and add a pinch of salt
or even a little more if you want that's
ready to your oats add half a cup of
sliced almonds this could be toasted
almonds you could use walnuts here you
can cons like I said before go crazy 1/2
a cup of shredded sweetened coconut you
don't want the sweet and stuff you can
use the unsweetened but you may need to
increase the sweetness in your oil
mixture then pour your honey oil mixture
over your oats have your oven preheating
to 350 degrees you'll bake this until
it's dried and golden brown about 16 to
20 minutes make sure you do stop and
stir it at least 2 or 3 times make sure
that everything is evenly coated and
then into your 350 degree oven 16 to 20
minutes
when your granola is golden take it out
of the oven and then add your dried
fruit one cup of dried fruit I'm adding
antioxidant rich blueberries for
deliciousness and helpfulness and as
easy as that you have homemade granola I
highly recommend making it yourself
because you can vary it however you want
you have more control over the
ingredients and I'm not gonna lie I bet
it's a lot less expensive than
store-bought
so there you go make it you guys and
bring it and give some to your mom this
Mother's Day
just a little additional gift hi guys
